column1: Polyuria is a fairly common symptom.

Some common causes of the problems are: - Diabetes insipidus - Diabetes mellitus - Drinking an excessive amounts water Less common causes include: - Kidney failure - Medicines such as diuretics and lithium - High or low calcium level in the body - Drinking alcohol and caffeine - Sickle cell anemia Also, your urine production may increase for 24 hours after having tests that involve injecting a special dye (contrast medium) into your vein during imaging tests such as a CT scan or an MRI scan.
Your health care provider will perform a physical exam and ask questions such as: - When did the problem started and has it changed over time?
